communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Hello Ms. Garcia,

Thank you for the update. Given that it's now been five months since we filed the initial request, are you able to provide an update as to whether you've identified the responsive documents, or what the source of the delay is?

Thank you,

Rebecca

communications.subject: ATTORNEY CLIENT PRIVILEGED - RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns,

Thank you for your inquiry and please accept our apologies for the delay.

As Mr. Scroggins noted in his August 3, 2023 email regarding our projected response, we always try to be prompt.  But as you might guess, the request references a large number of records.  As he said, we must thoroughly review all records to identify and obtain the responsive documents from both external and internal sources.  It is a complex and time-consuming process.

I am confident that we will have documents ready to provide on or before the December 6th, 2023, date noted in our recent communication.

Thank you for your continued patience!
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image002.png@01DA121F.C2136CB0]

Sincerely,
Julia Rock

communications.subject: Re: Request for Inspection of Records
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns:

As discussed in our letter of December 6, 2023, we are providing the records we currently have available in response to your June 16, 2023, request.  They are located at the website below:

MuckRock - Julia Rock<https://nmgov-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/personal/renee_garcia_erb_nm_gov/Documents/MuckRock%20-%20Julia%20Rock?csf=1&web=1&e=4gwfSH>

As also discussed, we will require additional time to provide the remainder of the records.  We plan to provide additional documents on or before February 1, 2024.  Thank you again for your continued patience regarding this matter.
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image001.png@01DA29F0.5D899B00]

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Beverage Agreements
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Agreements related to the beverage pouring, distribution, or sales on campus or in athletics venues or facilities, including any related exclusive marketing agreements for beverage brands in those areas.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Kelly North

communications.subject: Welcome to the Records Center!
communications.communication:
Welcome to the UW-Madison Record Center. 
Thank you for registering - The Record Center enables you to submit requests, track their progress, view any related invoices and download any records that are responsive to your request! 
Login: 173833-21208475@requests.muckrock.com 
If you have never have used the system or have had staff create the account on your behalf, please click here to request a temporary password. (https://universityofwisconsin.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP/_rs/ForgotPassword.aspx)

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: P004090-092624
communications.communication:
The University of Wisconsin-Madison receives a high volume of public records requests. Your request has been placed in queue and we will process it as soon as possible.  Thank you for your patience. 
 
Dear Requester: 
 
We have received your public records request and the university will respond as required by the Wisconsin public records law, Wis. Stat. §§ 19.31-19.39 
 
Your request was received on September 26, 2024 and given the reference number P004090-092624 for tracking purposes. 
 
Records requested: 
 
Request: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Agreements related to the beverage pouring, distribution, or sales on campus or in athletics venues or facilities, including any related exclusive marketing agreements for beverage brands in those areas.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Kelly North

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Funiversity-wisconsin-469%252Fbeverage-agreements-173833%252F%253Femail%253Djlattis%252540uwsa.edu&url_auth_token=AAAaLlXzDpYqEy7BpvZcBdvNMRw%3A1su0vk%3A5kUIwtNALvyYON3iOs2Yy7sjiRRtAWDfrAxNt8_0K1A 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at this link and then by selecting "View My Requests." 
You'll receive an email when your request has been completed. 
 
Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
 
 
Sincerely, 
UW-Madison Records Custodian 
608-265-6018 

Track the issue status and respond at: https://universityofwisconsin.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP//_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=4334

communications.subject: Kelly North  Public Records Request :: P004090-092624
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
 Public Records Request: P004090-092624 
 
   
  
 RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of September 26, 2024 Reference # P004090-092624 Dear Requester, I am writing in response to your public records request of September 26, 2024, in which you requested the following: Agreements related to the beverage pouring, distribution, or sales on campus or in athletics venues or facilities, including any related exclusive marketing agreements for beverage brands in those areas. Access the Public Records Center to download the responsive records. The university has responded to your request and it is now closed. Sincerely, Elizabeth Wilkerson Assistant Public Records Custodian Office of Compliance University of Wisconsin-Madison

title: Sturgis destruction and transfer (Federal Bureau of Investigation)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Sturgis destruction and transfer (Federal Bureau of Investigation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Documents ordering, mentioning, authorizing, or otherwise relating to the destruction and/or transfer of documents potentially responsive to Frank Sturgis. See the attached FOIA response letter for additional information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma North-Best

communications.subject: eFOIA Request Received
communications.communication:
# Individual Information

Prefix First Name Middle Name Last Name Suffix Email Phone Location

# Domestic Address

Address Line 1 Address Line 2 City State Postal

# Agreement to Pay

How you will pay

I am requesting a fee waiver for my request and have reviewed the FOIA
reference guide. If my fee waiver is denied, I would like to limit my request
to the two free hours of searching and 100 duplicated pages.

# Proof Of Affiliation for Fee Waiver

Waiver Explanation

    
    
    I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have
    previously written
    about the government and its activities, with some reaching over 100,000
    readers in outlets such
    as Gizmodo, MuckRock, Motherboard, Property of the People, Unicorn Riot, and
    The Outline,
    among others. As such, as I have a reasonable expectation of publication and
    my editorial and
    writing skills are well established. In addition, I discuss and comment on
    the files online and
    make them available through non-profits such as the library Internet Archive
    and the journalist
    non-profit MuckRock, disseminating them to a large audience. While my
    research is not limited
    to this, a great deal of it, including this, focuses on the activities and
    attitudes of the government
    itself. As such, it is not necessary for me to demonstrate the relevance of
    this particular subject in
    advance.
    Further, case law states that â€œproof of the ability to disseminate the
    released information to a
    broad cross- section of the public is not required.â€� Judicial Watch, Inc. v.
    Depâ€™t of Justice, 365
    F.3d 1108, 1126 (D.C. Cir. 2004); see Carney v. U.S. Depâ€™t of Justice, 19 F.
    3d 807, 814-15 (2d
    Cir. 1994). Further, courts have held that "qualified because it also had
    â€œfirmâ€� plans to â€œpublish a
    number of . . . â€˜document setsâ€™â€� concerning United States foreign and
    national security policy."
    Under this criteria, as well, I qualify as a member of the news media.
    Additionally, courts have held that the news media status "focuses on the
    nature of the requester,
    not its request. The provision requires that the request be â€œmade byâ€� a
    representative of the news
    media. Id. Â§ 552(a)(4)(A)(ii)(II). A newspaper reporter, for example, is a
    representative of the
    news media regardless of how much interest there is in the story for which
    he or she is requesting
    information." As such, the details of the request itself are moot for the
    purposes of determining
    the appropriate fee category.
    As my primary purpose is to inform about government activities by reporting
    on it and making
    the raw data available, I request that fees be waived.
    This request specifically includes both previously processed and previously
    unprocessed
    documents. If the documents are 25 or more years old and previously
    processed documents were
    processed before the 25th anniversary of the documentâ€™s creation, I request
    that in addition to the
    previous processed copy, the document be reprocessed and redactions
    reviewed.

Documentation Files

# Non-Individual FOIA Request

Request Information

    
    
    To Whom It May Concern:
    
    Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following
    records:
    
    Documents ordering, mentioning, authorizing, or otherwise relating to the
    destruction and/or transfer of documents potentially responsive to Frank
    Sturgis. See the attached FOIA response letter for additional information.
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
    forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    Emma North-Best
    
    Attachments:
    
    
    https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/EmmaBest/135917/Eb8208e3ea362e7349db82cab867d9dfa3df90b7e417aa7dd10_Q211929_R436038_D165187150.pdf
    
    https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/EmmaBest/135917/Fee_category_and_search_parameters.pdf
    Upload documents directly:
    https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252Fsturgis-destruction-and-transfer-federal-bureau-of-investigation-162770%252F%253Femail%253Defoia%252540subscriptions.fbi.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj2IL5VXXnRlJt19ouwfRAn8Y%3A1s1z32%3AK9FBoRbGjfEaTGXle-1JSTwb3vHJgcGGud6ncJXgDaE

**

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

**

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBIâ€™s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBIâ€™s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request toolâ€™ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.
